segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts

segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts

segment.source: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts
segment.target: Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts

segment.source: This topic lists the roles and accounts that you must create in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) to provide security and access rights for the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) databases, reports, and web applications.
segment.target: This topic lists the roles and accounts that you must create in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) to provide security and access rights for the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) databases, reports, and web applications.

segment.source: For each role and account, the corresponding field in the MBAM Server Configuration wizard is provided.
segment.target: For each role and account, the corresponding field in the MBAM Server Configuration wizard is provided.

segment.source: For a list of Windows PowerShell cmdlets and parameters that correspond to these accounts, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For a list of Windows PowerShell cmdlets and parameters that correspond to these accounts, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: MBAM does not support the use of managed service accounts.
segment.target: MBAM does not support the use of managed service accounts.

segment.source: Database accounts
segment.target: Database accounts

segment.source: Create the following accounts for the Compliance and Audit Database and the Recovery Database.
segment.target: Create the following accounts for the Compliance and Audit Database and the Recovery Database.

segment.source: Account name and purpose
segment.target: Account name and purpose

segment.source: Account type
segment.target: Account type

segment.source: MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account
segment.target: MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account

segment.source: Description of the MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account
segment.target: Description of the MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database read/write user or group for reports
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database and Recovery Database read/write user or group for reports

segment.source: User or Group
segment.target: User or Group

segment.source: Read/write access domain user or group
segment.target: Read/write access domain user or group

segment.source: Domain user or group that has read/write access to the Compliance and Audit Database and the Recovery Database to enable the web applications to access the data and reports in these databases.
segment.target: Domain user or group that has read/write access to the Compliance and Audit Database and the Recovery Database to enable the web applications to access the data and reports in these databases.

segment.source: If you enter a user name in this field, it must be the same value as the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page.
segment.target: If you enter a user name in this field, it must be the same value as the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page.

segment.source: If you enter a group name in this field, the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page must be a member of the group you enter in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a group name in this field, the value in the Web service application pool domain account field on the Configure Web Applications page must be a member of the group you enter in this field.

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database read-only user or group for reports
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database read-only user or group for reports

segment.source: User or Group
segment.target: User or Group

segment.source: Read-only access domain user or group
segment.target: Read-only access domain user or group

segment.source: Name of the user or group that will have read-only access to the Compliance and Audit Database to enable the reports to access the compliance and audit data in this database.
segment.target: Name of the user or group that will have read-only access to the Compliance and Audit Database to enable the reports to access the compliance and audit data in this database.

segment.source: If you enter a user name in this field, it must be the same user as the one you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page.
segment.target: If you enter a user name in this field, it must be the same user as the one you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page.

segment.source: If you enter a group name in this field, the value that you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page must be a member of the group that you specify in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a group name in this field, the value that you specify in the Compliance and Audit Database domain account field on the Configure Reports page must be a member of the group that you specify in this field.

segment.source: Reporting accounts
segment.target: Reporting accounts

segment.source: Create the following accounts for the Reports feature.
segment.target: Create the following accounts for the Reports feature.

segment.source: Account name/purpose
segment.target: Account name/purpose

segment.source: Account type
segment.target: Account type

segment.source: MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account
segment.target: MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account

segment.source: Description of the MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account
segment.target: Description of the MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account

segment.source: Reports read-only domain access group
segment.target: Reports read-only domain access group

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: Reporting role domain group
segment.target: Reporting role domain group

segment.source: Name of the domain group whose members have read-only access to the reports in the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Name of the domain group whose members have read-only access to the reports in the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database domain user account
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database domain user account

segment.source: User
segment.target: User

segment.source: Compliance and Audit Database domain account
segment.target: Compliance and Audit Database domain account

segment.source: Domain user account and password that the local SQL Server Reporting Services instance uses to access the Compliance and Audit Database.
segment.target: Domain user account and password that the local SQL Server Reporting Services instance uses to access the Compliance and Audit Database.

segment.source: This account requires Log On as Batch rights to the SQL Server Reporting Services server.
segment.target: This account requires Log On as Batch rights to the SQL Server Reporting Services server.

segment.source: If the value you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a user name, you must enter that same value in this field.
segment.target: If the value you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a user name, you must enter that same value in this field.

segment.source: If the value you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a group name, the value that you enter in this field must be a member of that group.
segment.target: If the value you enter in the Read-only access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page is a group name, the value that you enter in this field must be a member of that group.

segment.source: Configure the password for this account to never expire.
segment.target: Configure the password for this account to never expire.

segment.source: The user account should be able to access all data that is available to the MBAM Reports Users group.
segment.target: The user account should be able to access all data that is available to the MBAM Reports Users group.

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website (Help Desk) accounts
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website (Help Desk) accounts

segment.source: Create the following accounts for the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Create the following accounts for the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Account name/purpose
segment.target: Account name/purpose

segment.source: Account type
segment.target: Account type

segment.source: MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account
segment.target: MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account

segment.source: Description of the MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account
segment.target: Description of the MBAM Server Configuration wizard field that corresponds to this account

segment.source: Web service application pool domain account
segment.target: Web service application pool domain account

segment.source: User
segment.target: User

segment.source: Web service application pool domain account
segment.target: Web service application pool domain account

segment.source: Domain user account to be used by the application pool for the web applications.
segment.target: Domain user account to be used by the application pool for the web applications.

segment.source: If you enter a user name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, you must enter that same value in this field.
segment.target: If you enter a user name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, you must enter that same value in this field.

segment.source: If you enter a group name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, the value you enter in this field must be a member of that group.
segment.target: If you enter a group name in the Read/write access domain user or group field on the Configure Databases page, the value you enter in this field must be a member of that group.

segment.source: If you do not specify credentials, the credentials that were specified for any previously enabled web application will be used.
segment.target: If you do not specify credentials, the credentials that were specified for any previously enabled web application will be used.

segment.source: All web applications must use the same application pool credentials.
segment.target: All web applications must use the same application pool credentials.

segment.source: If you specify different credentials for different web applications, the most recently specified value will be used.
segment.target: If you specify different credentials for different web applications, the most recently specified value will be used.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For improved security, set the account that is specified in the credentials to have limited user rights.
segment.target: For improved security, set the account that is specified in the credentials to have limited user rights.

segment.source: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users access group
segment.target: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users access group

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users
segment.target: MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have access to all recovery areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have access to all recovery areas of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Users who have this role have to enter only the recovery key, and not the end user’s domain and user name, when helping end users recover their drives.
segment.target: Users who have this role have to enter only the recovery key, and not the end user’s domain and user name, when helping end users recover their drives.

segment.source: If a user is a member of both the MBAM Helpdesk Users group and the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group, the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group permissions override the MBAM Helpdesk Group permissions.
segment.target: If a user is a member of both the MBAM Helpdesk Users group and the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group, the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group permissions override the MBAM Helpdesk Group permissions.

segment.source: MBAM Helpdesk Users access group
segment.target: MBAM Helpdesk Users access group

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: MBAM Helpdesk Users
segment.target: MBAM Helpdesk Users

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have access to the Manage TPM and Drive Recovery areas of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have access to the Manage TPM and Drive Recovery areas of the MBAM Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Individuals who have this role must fill-in all fields, including the end-user’s domain and account name, when they use either option.
segment.target: Individuals who have this role must fill-in all fields, including the end-user’s domain and account name, when they use either option.

segment.source: If a user is a member of both the MBAM Helpdesk Users group and the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group, the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group permissions override the MBAM Helpdesk Group permissions.
segment.target: If a user is a member of both the MBAM Helpdesk Users group and the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group, the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users group permissions override the MBAM Helpdesk Group permissions.

segment.source: MBAM Report Users access group
segment.target: MBAM Report Users access group

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: MBAM Report Users
segment.target: MBAM Report Users

segment.source: Domain user group whose members have read-only access to the reports in the Reports area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Domain user group whose members have read-only access to the reports in the Reports area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: MBAM Data Migration User Group
segment.target: MBAM Data Migration User Group

segment.source: Group
segment.target: Group

segment.source: MBAM Data Migration Users
segment.target: MBAM Data Migration Users

segment.source: Optional domain user group whose members have permissions to write data to MBAM by using the MBAM Recovery and Hardware Service running on the MBAM server.
segment.target: Optional domain user group whose members have permissions to write data to MBAM by using the MBAM Recovery and Hardware Service running on the MBAM server.

segment.source: This account is generally used with the Write-Mbam* cmdlets to write recovery and TPM data from Active Directory into the MBAM database.
segment.target: This account is generally used with the Write-Mbam* cmdlets to write recovery and TPM data from Active Directory into the MBAM database.

segment.source: For more information, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.
segment.target: For more information, see MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
